com.brightcove.player

Interface MediaPlayerService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.os.IInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MediaPlayerService.Stub

    public interface MediaPlayerService
extends android.os.IInterface

    The contract of a service that can be launched by submitting an Android Intent to launch a video player that will run independently in the background. The video view will appear on top of all applications.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MediaPlayerService.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

    • Method Detail

      • addVideo

        void addVideo(Video video)
       throws android.os.RemoteException
        Adds a video to the list of tracks to be played.
        Parameters:
        video - the video to be added.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • setPlaylist

        void setPlaylist(Playlist playlist)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Sets the list of media to be played by the service. If the service is already playing, then the playback will be stopped and the service will automatically play the first entry in the playlist. If the playlist is null, then the effect of calling this method is the same as calling clearPlaylist() method.
        Parameters:
        playlist -
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • clearPlaylist

        void clearPlaylist()
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Clears the current playlist, if any. If the service is already playing a media, then the playback will be stopped automatically
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • getPlaylist

        Playlist getPlaylist()
              throws android.os.RemoteException
        Fetches the current list of media from the player.
        Returns:
        the current playlist.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • isPlaying

        boolean isPlaying()
           throws android.os.RemoteException
        Checks if the service is currently playing a media.
        Returns:
        true if the player is currently playing, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • hasPrevious

        boolean hasPrevious()
             throws android.os.RemoteException
        Checks if the playlist has a media track before the current track.
        Returns:
        true if the playlist contains a media track before the current track, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        hasNext()

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()
         throws android.os.RemoteException
        Checks if the playlist has a media track after the current track.
        Returns:
        true if the playlist contains a media track after the current track, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        hasPrevious()

      • countTracks

        int countTracks()
         throws android.os.RemoteException
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • getCurrentTrackIndex

        int getCurrentTrackIndex()
                  throws android.os.RemoteException
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • startPlayback

        void startPlayback()
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Plays the current track from the beginning. If the media service is already playing a media, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • playFirstTrack

        void playFirstTrack()
             throws android.os.RemoteException
        Starts playback of the first media track in the playlist. If the playlist is empty, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • playPreviousTrack

        void playPreviousTrack()
                throws android.os.RemoteException
        Starts playback of the previous media track in the playlist. If the playlist has no track before the current track, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        playFirstTrack(), playNextTrack(), playLastTrack(), startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • playNextTrack

        void playNextTrack()
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Starts playback of the next media track in the playlist. If the playlist has no track after the current track, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        playFirstTrack(), playPreviousTrack(), playLastTrack(), startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • playLastTrack

        void playLastTrack()
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Starts playback of the last media track in the playlist. If the playlist is empty or if the media player is already playing the last track, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        playFirstTrack(), playPreviousTrack(), playNextTrack(), startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • playTrack

        void playTrack(int trackNumber)
        throws android.os.RemoteException
        Starts playback of the media track at the specified position in the playlist. If the media player is already playing the requested track, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        trackNumber - the position of the track within the playlist that must be played. The first track number is 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the track number is not within range.
        android.os.RemoteException

      • pausePlayback

        void pausePlayback()
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Pauses playing the current media track, if any. If the media service is currently not playing any media, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        startPlayback(), resumePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • resumePlayback

        void resumePlayback()
             throws android.os.RemoteException
        Resumes playing the current media track from the current play head position. If the media service is currently not playing any media, then calling this method will the same effect as calling startPlayback() method.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), stopPlayback(), isPlaying()

      • stopPlayback

        void stopPlayback()
           throws android.os.RemoteException
        Stop playing the current media track, if any. The play head position will be reset to zero. If the media service is currently not playing any media, then calling this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        See Also:
        startPlayback(), pausePlayback(), resumePlayback(), isPlaying()

      • setListener

        void setListener(MediaPlayerListener listener)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Sets/clears the listener that will be invoked by the media player service when a media event of interest occurs.
        Parameters:
        listener - null or reference to a listener that should be notified.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
